item.title: LEVEL-5 announces TGS 2025 lineup
item.content:encoded:
Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road and Professor Layton and The New World of Steam.

LEVEL-5 has opened its Tokyo Game Show 2025 website and announced its lineup of games for the event, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan.

Get the details below.

■ Lineup

  • FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PS4, Switch, PC)
  • Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PS4, Switch, PC)
  • Professor Layton and The New World of Steam (Switch 2, Switch)

The LEVEL-5 booth will feature multiple demo stations for Professor Layton and the New World of Steam and INAZUMA ELEVEN: Victory Road. In addition, at the Family Game Park, you can also try out FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time, bringing the total to three playable titles. Come enjoy our latest games together with your family and friends!

*All titles in both the LEVEL-5 General Exhibition Area and the Family Game Park will be playable on Nintendo Switch 2.

■ Trial Rewards

FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time

Original Memo Pad

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road

Original Rubber Wristband

*One original rubber wristband (random design) will be given per demo play.

Professor Layton and The New World of Steam

Original Smartphone Ring Holder

*The original smartphone ring holder uses an adhesive attachment.

■ Booth Visitor Rewards

Shiny A4-size Original Metallic Clear File!

*Available while supplies last.

■ Booth Map

■ Live Broadcast

September 25

  • 21:00 – LEVEL-5 Tokyo Game Show 2025 Official Program – We will be streaming a LEVEL-5 Live Broadcast as part of the Tokyo Game Show 2025 Official Program, beginning at 9pm on September 25th (JST). The program will showcase gameplay from our titles along with the latest news. Stay tuned for more details!


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/level-5-announces-tgs-2025-lineup

item.title: Xbox Tokyo Game Show 2025 Broadcast set for September 25
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Updates from Xbox and partners in Japan, Asia, and around the world.

Microsoft Gaming will host the Xbox Tokyo Game Show 2025 Broadcast on September 25 at 3:00 a.m. PT / 6:00 a.m. ET / 19:00 JST, the company announced. It will feature content from Microsoft Gaming’s creative teams, as well as “exciting updates” from partners in Japan, Asia, and around the world. You will be able to watch it on YouTube (English, Japanese) and Twitch (English).

The live stream will be available on select Xbox social channels in Japanese, English, Korean, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Arabic (MSA), French, German, Italian, Polish, Brazilian Portuguese, Castilian Spanish, Mexican Spanish, and Turkish, as well as in Japanese Sign Language (JSL), American Sign Language (ASL), and with audio descriptions in both Japanese and English. Following the broadcast, language support will be added for Canadian French, Filipino, Hindi, Indonesian, Malay, Māori, Russian, Thai, Ukranian, and Vietnamese.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/xbox-tokyo-game-show-2025-broadcast-set-for-september-25

item.title: Digimon Story: Time Stranger demo announced
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Coming "soon," but no specific date.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer Media.Vision will release a downloadable demo for Digimon Story: Time Stranger ahead of the game’s release.

The news comes via a newly published interview with Gamersky, in which producer Ryosuke Hara confirms a demo is coming “soon.” 4Gamer.net‘s preview of the game today also confirms a demo is planned.

The new previews are based on four hours of hands-on with the game. Previews are available at 4Gamer.net (Japanese), Bahamut (Traditional Chinese), But Why Tho?, Checkpoint, Comics Gaming Magazine, Easy Allies, Famitsu, Game Chosun (Korean), Game Rant, GamerBraves, Gamer.ne.jp (Japanese), Gamersky (Simplified Chinese), GameSpot, Geek Culture, IGN, MMORPG, Noisy Pixel, The Outer Haven, PlayStation Blog, PushSquare, ScreenHub, TheSixthAxis, TechRaptor, and WellPlayed.

Digimon Story: Time Stranger is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on October 3.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/digimon-story-time-stranger-demo-announced

item.title: Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter ‘Battle’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

Choose between real-time and turn-based combat.

Publisher GungHo Online Entertainment and developer Falcom have released a new trailer for Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter showcasing the game’s battle system.

Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter is due out for PlayStation 5, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam on September 19 worldwide. A demo is available now. Read more about the game here, here, here, here, here, here, and here.

Watch the trailer below.

Battle Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/trails-in-the-sky-1st-chapter-battle-trailer

item.title: Steel Knight’s ARMIS launches October 8
item.content:encoded:
Ensemble drama and roguelike shoot ’em up hybrid Steel Knight’s ARMIS will launch for PC via Steam on October 8, developer Izanami Game Lab announced. A demo is now available, allowing you to play through the game to Chapter 2.

Here is an overview of the demo, via Izanami Game Lab:

Players take on the role of pilots of the “ARMIS (Advanced Robotic Mechanized Interceptor System)” and lead the rebel forces against the Imperial and Earth Federation forces as they fight their way through a battlefield full of dramatic twists and turns. Not only will you face countless waves of enemies, but you’ll also face off against enemy pilots who pilot their own unique ARMIS.

And here is an overview of the game:

About

Steel Knight’s ARMIS is where ensemble drama meets roguelike shooting. Its gameplay bears many similarities to the survivors-like genre, bolstered by a rich story and a cast of unique characters. If you’re a fan of classic Japanese mecha anime like Gundam then this game is not to be missed! Board your ARMIS and face your destiny as you fight various battles against countless enemies.

Key Features

  • The Exhilaration of Annihilation – Overwhelm hordes of enemies through the sheer strength of your ARMIS! Keep upgrading your build and defeat them all
  • Dramatic Story – Expect high-impact drama to go alongside high-tension battles. The game features five full chapters each with a different protagonist and cast
  • Transition to Vertical Shooting – Seamlessly transition to a vertical shooting mode, delivering fresh and exhilarating gameplay – this is a survivor-like that’s built different!

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/steel-knights-armis-launches-october-8
